page.title: 14CLUBS IN GARTMORE
page.content: The{Village Club}is where winter activities take place with a full- size{snooker}table and a{Summer Ice} table. Summer Ice came to the area when Irish labourers were building the Glasgow water tunnels, and is played on a 22foot table with Steel "Stones". It is the indoor version of Curling, and it is also played in America as "Shuffle board". The{Curling Club}started in 1864 and its members play at Stirling Ice Rink. Gartmore has often won the local cup. There is a thriving fishing club who have competitions on local lochs and go out fishing nearly every weekend. The{Football Club}has been an institution for many years and the red and white strips can be seen at the local games where they have had their share of trophies.
